CULT.Definition: someone or something that has become very popular with a particular group of people

RECALL.Definition: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember

TENDED.Definition: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

PUB.Definition: a place, especially in Great Britain or Ireland, where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk and where food is often available

PINT.Definition: a measure for liquid equal to about half a litre. Typical measurement for a glass or beer in the UK.

BARELY.Definition: by the smallest amount; only just

INEVITABLY.Definition: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented

RELIABLE.Definition: Someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or believed because he, she, or it works or behaves well in the way you expect

CONSULT.Definition: to get information or advice from a person, book, etc. with special knowledge on a particular subject

TRACED.Definition: to find the origin of something

BREWERY.Definition: a company that makes beer or a place where beer is made

GAME.Definition: wild animals and birds that are hunted for food or sport

CONSULTED.Definition: to get information or advice from a person, book, etc. with special knowledge on a particular subject

MADE A CAREER OUT OF.Definition: created a career out of a particular area of expertise or experience

PHOTOGRAPHIC MEMORY.Definition: If you have a photographic memory, you are able to remember things in exact detail

TIRELESSLY.Definition: in an energetic and continuous way

COPYRIGHTED.Definition: under 'copyright' (the legal right to control the production and selling of a book, play, film, photograph, or piece of music)

BUBBLEGUM.Definition: chewing gum that you can blow into the shape of a bubble

LEAF THROUGH.Definition: to quickly turn the pages of a book or a magazine, reading only a little of it

BROWSE.Definition: to look through a book or magazine without reading everything, or to walk around a shop looking at several things without intending to buy any of them

CHOLESTEROL.Definition: a substance containing a lot of fat that is found in the body tissue and blood of all animals, thought to be part of the cause of heart disease if there is too much of it

UNORTHODOX.Definition: different from what is usual or expected in behaviour, ideas, methods, etc.

FINGERNAILS.Definition: the hard, slightly curved part that covers and protects the top of the end of a finger

GUIDELINES.Definition: information intended to advise people on how something should be done or what something should be

RULE OF THUMB.Definition: a practical and approximate way of doing or measuring something

VALID.Definition: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted

MOSAIC.Definition: a pattern or picture made using many small pieces of coloured stone or glass

SPONSORS.Definition: to support a person, organisation, or activity by giving money, encouragement, or other help

LOOP THE LOOP.Definition: a vertical circle in the air

MODEL.Definition: a type of something, e.g. a new model of car

SURPRISE, SURPRISE.Definition: said when someone has done something or when something has happened in a way that you expected and that you do not approve of

TWIST.Definition: a change in the way in which something happens

RELIES.Definition: to depend on or trust someone or something

PAY HANDSOMELY.Definition: pay a lot of money for

PRIVILEGE.Definition: an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable

ICONIC.Definition: very famous or popular, especially being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time

PUBLICITY.Definition: the activity of making certain that someone or something attracts a lot of interest or attention from many people, or the attention received as a result of this activity
